citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Land Management (BLM)
U.S. Department of Interior, Bureau of Land Management (BLM)
citeinfo.title: F_Bank_W

descript.abstract: Bank stability and cover data and bank angle data for wadeable reaches. Bank stability and cover is collected at 21 main and intermediate transects for left and right banks while bank angle is a contingent indicator and only collected at left and right banks at main transects. Both bank stability and cover and bank angle may be collected on side channels when present. Bank angle is measured with a clinometer following Acher et al. 2015 methods. Acute angles are overhanging banks and obtuse are laid back banks.
descript.purpose: Bank stability and cover data and bank angle data for wadeable reaches. Bank stability and cover is collected at 21 main and intermediate transects for left and right banks while bank angle is a contingent indicator and only collected at left and right banks at main transects. Both bank stability and cover and bank angle may be collected on side channels when present. Bank angle is measured with a clinometer following Acher et al. 2015 methods. Acute angles are overhanging banks and obtuse are laid back banks.

idinfo.accconst: None, these data are considered public domain.
idinfo.useconst: These data are provided by Bureau of Land Management (BLM) "as is" and might contain errors or omissions. The User assumes the entire risk associated with its use of these data and bears all responsibility in determining whether these data are fit for the User's intended use. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the sources from which they were derived, and both scale and accuracy may vary across the data set. These data might not have the accuracy, resolution, completeness, timeliness, or other characteristics appropriate for applications that potential users of the data may contemplate. The User is encouraged to carefully consider the content of the metadata file associated with these data. These data are neither legal documents nor land surveys, and must not be used as such. Official records may be referenced at most BLM offices. Please report any errors in the data to the BLM office from which it was obtained. The BLM should be cited as the data source in any products derived from these data. Any Users wishing to modify the data should describe the types of modifications they have performed. The User should not misrepresent the data, nor imply that changes made were approved or endorsed by BLM. This data may be updated by the BLM without notification.

attracc.attraccr: Contact contributor of specific features for accuracy information

dataqual.logic: Data are related to the I_Indicators layer based upon the EvaluationID.

horizpa.horizpar: Contact contributor of specific features for accuracy information

procstep.procdesc: Data were collected by trained field crews with the BLM and partner organizations. They followed the BLM core aquatic core and contingent indicators in TR 1735-2 (AIM National Aquatic Monitoring Framework: Field Protocol for Wadeable Lotic System). Pre-2021 data were captured electronically using the Stream And River Assessment Hub (SARAH), and 2021 and later data were collected using Survey123. They were managed by the data collectors, with oversight from BLM field offices, state offices, and the National Operations Center. This dataset has undergone rigorous QA/QC to ensure data quality.

cntaddr.address: BLM National Operations Center; Denver Federal Center,Building 50

enttyp.enttypd: Bank stability and cover data and bank angle data for wadeable reaches. Bank stability and cover is collected at 21 main and intermediate transects for left and right banks while bank angle is a contingent indicator and only collected at left and right banks at main transects. Both bank stability and cover and bank angle may be collected on side channels when present. Bank angle is measured with a clinometer following Acher et al. 2015 methods. Acute angles are overhanging banks and obtuse are laid back banks.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique visit or evaluation identifier; PointID concatenated with the evaluation/ sampled date

attrdomv.udom: Unique visit or evaluation identifier; PointID concatenated with the evaluation/ sampled date

attr.attrdef: 11 main or 10 intermediate transects are established at systematic intervals throughout the reach and labeled alphabetically with A, B etc. for main transects and AB, BC for intermediate transects. Main transects may also extend to side channels if present which are designated by XA, XB etc.

attrdomv.udom: 11 main or 10 intermediate transects are established at systematic intervals throughout the reach and labeled alphabetically with A, B etc. for main transects and AB, BC for intermediate transects. Main transects may also extend to side channels if present which are designated by XA, XB etc.

attr.attrdef: Left or right bank of the stream as one looks downstream

attrdomv.udom: Left or right bank of the stream as one looks downstream

attr.attrdef: Erosional or depositional bank as defined by the field protocol

attrdomv.udom: Erosional or depositional bank as defined by the field protocol

attr.attrdef: Percent of 42 banks with greater than 50% foliar cover provided by perennial vegetation, wood or mineral substrate greater than 15 cm (units: %, min: 0, max: 100, n= 42)
Percent of 42 banks with greater than 50% basal cover provided by perennial vegetation, wood or mineral substrate greater than 15 cm (units: %, min: 0, max: 100, n= 42)
Percent of bank stability plot covered with bedrock
Percent of bank stability plot covered with cobble greater than 15 cm
Percent of bank stability plot covered with large wood
Percent of bank stability plot covered with perennial vegetation as assessed by foliar cover
Percent of bank stability plot covered with perennial vegetation as assessed by basal cover
Dominant type of erosional features present, if any (Eroding, Slough, Slump, Fracture, Absent)

attrdomv.udom: Dominant type of erosional features present, if any (Eroding, Slough, Slump, Fracture, Absent)

attr.attrdef: Bank angle in degrees - PIBO method; acute angles are overhanging banks and obtuse are laid back banks
Obtuse or acute angle; used in app to determine if the input value should be subtracted from 180; acute angles are overhanging banks and obtuse are laid back banks

attrdomv.udom: Obtuse or acute angle; used in app to determine if the input value should be subtracted from 180; acute angles are overhanging banks and obtuse are laid back banks

attr.attrdef: Indicates if there was any difficulty collecting bank angle and if measurements were estimated. Measurements may be estimated if depth rods can't be placed at the correct angle due to vegetation on the bank.

attrdomv.udom: Indicates if there was any difficulty collecting bank angle and if measurements were estimated. Measurements may be estimated if depth rods can't be placed at the correct angle due to vegetation on the bank.

attr.attrdef: Indicates for each specific bank and transect if there was any difficulty collecting bank stability or cover or if stability, cover, or scour line was estimated

attrdomv.udom: Indicates for each specific bank and transect if there was any difficulty collecting bank stability or cover or if stability, cover, or scour line was estimated

attr.attrdef: A unique identifier for each row in each table

attrdomv.udom: A unique identifier for each row in each table

attr.attrdef: Name of the user that created the data entry.

attrdomv.udom: Name of the user that created the data entry.

attr.attrdef: Date the data entry was created.

attrdomv.udom: Date the data entry was created.

attr.attrdef: Name of the user that last edited the data.

attrdomv.udom: Name of the user that last edited the data.

attr.attrdef: Date the data was last edited.

attrdomv.udom: Date the data was last edited.

overview.eaover: Entities are broad data types and attributes are specific AIM indicators collected at reaches across BLM lands for a variety of purposes.

Although these data have been processed successfully on computers of BLM, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by BLM regarding the use of these data on any other system, or for general or scientific purposes, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
